author: stsp
msg: Make 'svn patch' do offset searching when applying hunks.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/patch_tests.py
(patch_unidiff_offset): New unit test.
* subversion/libsvn_client/patch.c
(match_hunk, scan_for_match): New helper functions for offset searching.
(determine_hunk_line): Use new helpers to do offset searching while
figuring out where a hunk should be applied.
(apply_one_hunk): Adjust for changes made to determine_hunk_line(),
and only call it if the patch target existed prior to patch application.
If there's nothing to search, we might as well not bother.

author: rhuijben
msg: * subversion/libsvn_wc/lock.c
(svn_wc_adm_probe_retrieve):
Following up on r38374, revert accidental change.
Suggested by: gstein

author: rhuijben
msg: Add helper function to open an adm_access baton associated with a working copy
context. This is necessary to workaround some temporary issues during the
transition towards using svn_wc_context_t everywhere.
This fixes most of the current Windows test failures.
* subversion/include/private/svn_wc_private.h
(svn_wc__adm_open_in_context): New function.
* subversion/libsvn_client/commit.c
(svn_client_commit4): Open commit root using
svn_wc__adm_open_in_context to allow closing open wc databases.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/lock.c
(svn_wc_adm_probe_retrieve): Accidental change. [Reverted in r38375]
(svn_wc__adm_open_in_context): New function.

author: rhuijben
msg: Make our Windows crashdump handler compatible with the Windows Vista
and newer DBGHELP.DLL versions.
Windows Vista changed the version numbering of DBGHELP.dll to match
the OS version number, which is lower than the version we checked for.
Instead of looking for a version number, we now just check if the DLL exports
the right functions.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/win32_crashrpt.c
(check_dbghelp_version): Remove function.
(load_dbghelp_dll): Don't check version number before loading DLL.

author: stsp
msg: Fix up the use of streams in unidiff application code a little.
* subversion/libsvn_client/patch.c
(patch_target_t): New member STREAM, which is opened when the target
is initialised and can be used to read lines from the target file.
We were already opening and closing a stream in two separate
places for this purpose, so it makes sense to put this here.
Also, move a boolean field around so all booleans are grouped together.
(init_patch_target): Initialise new STREAM member.
(copy_lines_to_target): Don't open a new stream to read lines from
the target, just use the existing one. Also, don't increment the
line count if end-of-file was reached.
(read_lines_from_target): Don't open a new stream to read lines from
the target, just use the existing one. Also, mention the caller's
responsibility to close the returned stream in the docstring.
(copy_latest_text): There's no point in disowning an already disowned
stream, so don't do that. Also don't forget to close any streams created.
(apply_one_hunk): Close the stream returned by read_lines_from_target().
(apply_one_patch): Close the new STREAM member of patch_target_t.
